ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Re: Rails 3.2 and PATCH
ygData.msgSnippet: No intermediary mechanisms (real world or theoretical) rely on PUT requests being full-replace across the whole web, making that part of the protocol instead

From: Mike Kelly <mike@...>
Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Re: Rails 3.2 and PATCH
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=364579677; y=Iiwvic6_Hg1nK4P3GMX6CR-nGQ6pAFnYJYRd_3WW0AKPq_k
X-Yahoo-Profile: pleb1985

No intermediary mechanisms (real world or theoretical) rely on PUT
requests being full-replace across the whole web, making that part of
the protocol instead of allowing applications to determine this
according to their requirements is not only redundant semantic bloat;
it's unnecessarily restrictive.

On Fri, Dec 16, 2011 at 8:37 PM, Jan Algermissen
<jan.algermissen@...> wrote:
>
> On Dec 16, 2011, at 9:34 PM, Mike Kelly wrote:
>
>> Why does HTTP need all this application-ish baggage
>
> Since you ask - what 'baggage' specifically do you mean?
>
> Jan
>
